newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- regroup, but end down 1/8.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- regroup, but end down 1/8.

text.p: U.S. municipal bonds regained some lost ground late in the day, but ended the day in the loss column.
After fading as much as 3/8 by midday on economic data and a softer tone, muni prices crawled back to off about 1/8 on pure sentiment - "a better feel" - said one trader.
Revenue bonds were off about 1/8 to 1/4, while high grade bonds were off about 1/8.
There was not much action in the secondary, the trader said.
For Thursday, "we will watch Treasuries, follow their lead," the trader said. On Wednesday, the 30-year bond closed off 2/32 to yield 7.10 percent.
As for Wednesday's primary market, some deals were repriced, raising yields slightly.
"The weakest part of the market was in the longer intermediate range, reflected in the pricing," said a dealer.
Municipal bond sales on Wednesday totaled about $850 million in 27 sales.
The New York Metropolitan Transportation Authority led the pack with the largest negotiated offering, a $383 million issue repriced to raise yields, through a syndicate headed by Bear Stearns & Co.
Oregon's sale of $155 million of certificate of participations were restructured, according to Bear Stearns.
Municipal bond sales for Thursday, April 17 are expected to total $169 million in 17 sales, according to Reuters Municipal Bond Information Group.
Negotiated offerings total $143 million in five sales, with a $97 million Missouri Housing Development Corporation through A.G. Edwards & Sons, Inc. topping the list.
On the competitive side, 12 sales totaling $26 million are on the schedule. A $23 million Sarrah Scott Middle School District, Ind., deal at 1400 EDT is the largest.
An additional nine sales totaling $256 million are on the possible calender, meaning underwriters have said they may price the bonds Thursday, depending on market conditions.
In debt futures at the close, June Treasury bonds fell five ticks to 107-15/32, while June municipal bonds lost 10 ticks to 112-9/32. The MOB spread closed at 154 ticks, down from 159 on Tuesday.
